title: Anthropic RSP ASL-3 Threshold Compliance
source_note: Based on Anthropic's Responsible Scaling Policy (Version 2.2, October 2024). Ref: https://www.anthropic.com/responsible-scaling-policy

compute_threshold.description: RSP evaluation trigger: Models are tested when they reach 4x the compute of the most recently tested model. This threshold represents a significant capability jump requiring comprehensive safety evaluation before deployment.
compute_threshold.regulatory_consequence: Triggers mandatory capability threshold evaluation per RSP Section 3

evaluation_names: CBRN capabilities evaluation (RSP Section 4.1): Assess if model can meaningfully assist in creating/deploying CBRN weapons
Cybersecurity capabilities evaluation (RSP Section 4.2): Assess offensive cyber capabilities and vulnerability discovery
Model Autonomy evaluation (RSP Section 4.3): Assess autonomous AI R&D and self-improvement capabilities
Persuasion and manipulation evaluation: Assess deceptive persuasion and social engineering capabilities
Deception and sandbagging evaluation: Assess whether model conceals capabilities during evaluation
required_evaluations.description: RSP mandates comprehensive capability evaluations in CBRN, cyber, and autonomy domains. Evaluations compare model-assisted outcomes versus 2023-baseline resources, assuming attacker has funding and up to one year but no initial specialized expertise.

items: Responsible Scaling Officer notified of evaluation results
Internal access controls and clearance levels implemented (ASL-3 Security)
Model weight protection measures active (ASL-3 Security)
Multi-tier compartmentalization controls based on asset type
Red team evaluation completed by internal safety team
External red team or third-party evaluation conducted
Capability threshold determination documented and reviewed
Anonymous staff reporting channel for RSP noncompliance operational
policy_checklist.description: ASL-3 standard requirements for models approaching capability thresholds. Includes enhanced security measures, deployment controls, and governance mechanisms per RSP Section 5.

notes.verification_scope: This ZK proof verifies that required evaluations were conducted and policy items completed. It does NOT verify: (1) that evaluations correctly assessed model capabilities, (2) that the model is actually safe to deploy, (3) that ASL-2 remains appropriate, (4) quality of security implementations.
notes.complementary_mechanisms: Independent capability evaluations (e.g., METR, Apollo), third-party security audits, ongoing 3-month re-evaluation cycle
